blogContentHtml.title: I don't retaliate.... without style üòé
blogContentHtml.content:
I don't typically like to play psychological games with people; either say what you got to say and at least try to clear the air, or buzz off cuz I almost always got other issues to tackle. I made an exception to this personal policy with a large order from the store's biggest customer. My guess from the conversation between Boss Man and Middle Man (the guy that acts as a middleman between this store and the taqueria that orders from the store), the location where they get their drinks and other things is currently closed, so today's order was double the size it normally is. For context, every Sunday, this taqueria orders 15 boxes of 30lb tripe, and then whatever other miscellaneous things like cheese, meats, cups, napkins, soaps, etc., and usually we end up hitting just shy of the 450lb mark of goods. This morning though, we very easily hit the 600+lb with the extra Mexican drinks and other heavy items that they ordered through the phone.

So the reason I bring all of this up is because on Sundays, I'm the one that tackles this order and gets everything non-meat in a cart, and during checkout, whoever loads the items onto Middle Man's truck gets a $5-$10 tip. Last week, the order was unusually large, so I ended up heaving and ho-ing all kinds of boxes into the cart, and then KnuckleHead Man, the coworker that takes care of this order from Monday through Saturday, loaded everything into the truck. What would have been fair is for KnuckleHead Man to have shared the tip, just like I shared my tip with Chief.com some weeks ago. Instead, he took all the tip to himself, and went on to do whatever else he does on Sundays. I obviously wasn't happy about it, but I wasn't going to make a big deal about it since, thankfully, I have plenty of hours to work during the week and I get paid enough to overcome my debts and still have some leftover to save for critical life expenses. So, whatever. Boss Man noticed that KnuckleHead Man didn't share the tip, and even said that that was bs and I should go fight for some. I let him know it's fine, and just left it at that.

But today's eeeextra large order was very much a two man task, and when Boss Man saw everything that was going to be loaded, he just started laughing his ass off. He said,

God damn, KnuckleHead Man‚Ä¶.

And he couldn't finish his words from how much he was laughing. I started laughing too because this man was going to be out there sweating like a pig in this hot, humid, sunny Texas morning for his precious tip that I generously and happily let him have all to himself üòÇüòÇüòÇ The big moment to load everything up came, and sure enough, KnuckleHead Man wasn't going to be missing out on his cut.

But the look on his face when he saw everything was priceless. Boss Man and I started laughing, and when everything was done and Middle Man left, KnuckleHead Man came up to me and said

You should have helped me man, look at all the f*cken sweat I'm covered in!

ü§£ü§£ü§£ That was well worth the tip I missed this week.

blogContentHtml.title: Saturday morning?? More like Valentine's Night
blogContentHtml.content:
Love Doctor (‚ïØ¬∞‚ñ°¬∞)‚ïØÔ∏µ ‚îª‚îÅ‚îª reporting in; this morning was hot hot hot! I don't know if it's because I'm paying more attention or I'm starting to get involved in some sort of love pentagram over here, but I got hit with not one but two different love handles this morning. So juicy bit coming in, either a coworker's got a mad crush on another coworker and is feeling fired up about asking, orrrrrr based on a really weirdly tender hug I saw the two sharing about a week ago, might be involved in something forbiddingly üå∂üî•üå∂üî•üå∂üî•üå∂ The way I found out is the dude told me

I'll leave you in charge of <female coworker> that you take care of her

lol what the f*ck?

Like, it was weird that he said it, and it was weirder that he kept repeating it, so there's that! Imma let that one brew for longer before dropping more goodies if anything else drops from that, so stay tuned ü§ê

On the second front, Female Me came at me today with some intense questioning about my opinion as a man. For starters, I'm humbled that anyone older than me would want that kind of opinion. But actually though, I'm more surprised that these conversation topics aren't left behind in high school age lol We all really are children that get stuck in ever-aging and eventually decaying bodies.

So Female Me wants my opinion on the behaviors of a man that she (or someone she knows, I couldn't really understand her that well through the mask, fans, music, etc.) speaks to. Apparently, the guy seems to be interested at first, but then later acts aloof or stops responding or calling altogether. I actually suspect that the guy might either have commitment issues, or he has more than one woman, but what I ended up telling her was that I can't make that kind of a judgment without knowing more details other than calling habits ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

Wow, adults are weird objects!

Grape Man's over once more! He's stopped getting the 4K brand cigarettes and started working on the other "inferior" 99¬¢ cigarettes. He came up to me while I was trying to pack some corn, and asked me

Do you know the area?

My initial reaction was confused, so I asked him

What area?

Black Olives.

Oh god, where is the conspiracy wheel going now‚Ä¶..

But no, he literally just wanted to know where the black olives were LMAO I was already bracing myself to hear some random shit like BlAcK oLiVeS bLoCk 5G or whatever ü§£ü§£ I found them for him, and we went along in peace.

blogContentHtml.title: I'm on that cash sh*t aahhh
blogContentHtml.content:
Quick, do 34.99√ó1.0825 by hand.

Go!

.
.
.
.

lol I did that today just for fun, but mostly because I was too lazy to go get my phone from another register to pull up the calculator real quick. I was trying to calculate how much money is to be made by buying a box of masks from Home Depot and selling them for $1 behind the Men's back. Turns out, if you can invest 100% of your money in this, there's a 31.9% profit for you to make by selling face masks obtained at that $34.99+tax price, so go figure üòã

The Men finally declared the need for a new cashier, so it looks like we're going to be looking at some interesting couple of weeks ahead. I call dibs on teaching the new cashier(s) the tips and tricks for success at this store -- literally don't fuck up and you're golden üòÇüòÇ My bet is that, assuming we get someone completely new to the game, we're going to end up going through a couple of people as they come to realize the heavy hand of the Men. Watch it's someone from the past coming back for that juicy, stable income lmao Honestly, I wouldn't blame 'em.

Sidenote, Kintsu you little shit‚Ä¶ I hope you're well bud üòî Afternoon transfers aren't the same without you fam ‚úä‚úä

Man, today was kind of a rough one for a Friday. It was so slow from 8am through 12pm, even the Nopal Lady didn't have her usual pep in her nopal cutting game. I saw her at some point just glaze eye the floor while she probably thought about god knows what that lady thinks about. She comes in, does her thing, and fkn leaves. No conversations with anyone, no bs. Just a straight, honest worker üí™üí™üëä

Happy Friday!!

blogContentHtml.title: Tick Tick Tick Tick Tick Tick
blogContentHtml.content:
It's been one million years since 2020 started; the Australia fires are just a figment in everyone's imagination, and Kobe Bryant checked out right before the real shit hit the fan. It's not uncommon for me to talk to many people where the general life happenings around us are getting extremely tiresome and it shows with how everyone interacts. Life is currently, undoubtedly, a giant chore from the moment you walk out the door to the moment you're safely back home ready (or not) for another day. Today, Militant Man, in the midst of everything that needs to get done in the store and in between the wakes of people coming in for their daily bread, showed some cracks as well. He tries his best to remain safe given all the different people he has to deal with on the daily, and he feels that despite wearing 3 face masks and washing his hands constantly, it's not enough to feel like he can keep this thing at bay. And it's true, one can only do so much, and unfortunately, we rely on the cooperation of everyone, including the Karens, dum dums, Princess Brothers, and you name 'em.

But boring non-news aside; it turns out that the damn things are real LMAOOO

This not-even-that-old-looking woman was proudly walking around the store with one of those today, lights flashing and all. I thought they were discontinued because I read somewhere that they were a flop because it made people feel old and useless, but hey, she's more ready than I will ever be for a trip to the hospital so more power to her üò§üò§üò§

So I haven't really worked on growing my playlist anymore -- life has gotten in the way and I feel that there's enough good stuff in there that it at least satisfies a good proportion of coworkers and customers alike. Today I heard a super rare event, a shy coworker singing to a Shakira song, albeit super quietly and in her own little corner, but it happened!

Feelsgoodman

Finally, I don't want to say that I'm famous, because I'm not. But this one lady walked up to my register, and so I started charging her items like I have everyone else. Then she makes a very curious question‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ She asks me if I "went to <this one specific high school>?" I was immediately intrigued on how she knows (ignore the shirts that I wear from there all the time lmao), so I said "Yeah, I did." Then she came at me directly with something that I never, and I mean never, expected to hear from a rando

Yeah, I recognized you from an interview you did on <local news channel>. You ended up going to <this one specific university> right?

I was so surprised that anyone would ever identify me from something I did such a long long time ago in an archaic and locally known video channel on YouTube that I couldn't stop myself from asking her how she knew lol I guess I came on a bit too strong because she got a little flustered, but I toned it down after the initial giant surprise and asked her if she knows anyone that went to that school. She said her two kids went there, and one graduated this year and is going to start university this coming school year in engineering.

But yeah, what they say is true. Be careful what you expose about yourself online cuz that sh*t will come back and haunt (or surprise you) in ways you never expect!

‚òÆ‚ô•&üòä

blogContentHtml.title: Grape Man? More like Great Man
blogContentHtml.content:
So Grape Man came in today full of shenanigans, but what makes today's special is that he's taken an interest in the golden ratio, which is right up my alley lmao

So, fun fact, the golden ratio is just a number that pops up when studying objects occurring in nature, and what it really is is, well, a ratio, between any two numbers, say a and b, where

(a + b) / a = a / b

If that throws your brain for a fit because you haven't done math since forever ago, don't fret. Just know that it's when you divide two different numbers that are built a certain way, and you get the same answer that is dubbed the "golden ratio". Another fun fact, this number's value is approximately 1.618.

Anyway, the golden ratio comes up in Grape Man's quantum discussion, and my brain starts firing away at just how dumb this man is going to be today. I ended up not paying any attention since he went on a tangent about vaccines again, so unfortunately my Grape Man shenanigan ends there, but should he mention it again, we got a solid foothold to challenge his theory.

Actually not really since that would mean having a heated discussion over stupid sh*t at a grocery store, so nevermind, but I would if I could lmao

I love my car.

blogContentHtml.title: I apologize in advance for the soliloquy, but it's difficult to ignore the daily muse.
blogContentHtml.content:
After sticking to this newfound schedule for the past couple of weeks and getting over the very dry hump of waking up at f*ck-this-sh*t o' clock every morning, I find that there's something magical about how the store comes to life every day. It starts out as a dark husk of a building whose only life are the ever-turning ceiling fans over the produce and maybe the occasional hobo sleeping in the cart corral. The doors are unlocked, the theft alarm is deactivated, and the line of workers waiting in the darkness outside hunkers in and rushes to the clock to punch in as fast as possible. Then, like a clockwork, you see the lights get turned on, the carts placed outside, avocados get processed, burners turned on, and finally, you get the cumbias from the lovely taqueria ladies playing in the background. That's when you know this is a new day, and it's time to put your game face on once more whether you want to or not. And then you start the day, and all is going as well as it can given the number of tasks needed to be executed and the number of people available to execute those tasks. Sometimes it's 3 people per task, sometimes it's 1 person for 10 tasks, but eventually after approximately 3 hours, task distributions even out to where they're going to be for the rest of the day right before the first wave of people hit the store.

Specifically today, nothing new happened. There were a few shenanigans from Diet Coke Lady as she effervescently pestered the folks around the line for money as per usual. She has some grotesque lipstick action going on, and honestly, I just feel bad for her at this point. Doesn't mean I'll give her free sh*t, she's got a horrible attitude and doesn't try to better her situation at least while she's around, so until that changes that's a no from me, dawg.

I still feel bad for the lady that lost her husband to covid though. She swung by the store today wearing black to let me know that a chicken bag she bought yesterday smells bad üò∂ Whatever man, I've decided to go easy on her for the time being so I told her to bring it and get it exchanged; hopefully she came by and got that swiftly resolved.

blogContentHtml.title: Beefy Sunday
blogContentHtml.content:
Today there was an undoubtedly nasty vibe in the air as people from all departments of the store were on the aggressive side. Even the coworkers that normally smile at me were kinda meh, and I'm not sure if this is always the case, but I actually witnessed some teamwork friction as a guy from one department complained about how he's the only one that gets tasked with doing different assignments when there are other people available‚Ä¶. Sounds like a personal problem than a task-sharing problem, especially since teamwork makes the dreamwork, and not to gloat, but the cashiers at the front have task loads pretty much figured out and (at least no one has vocalized to me personally) we get our sh*t done between the AM and PM teams fairly consistently. I even witnessed some major beef between one of the Men and a long time employee, so maybe today wasn't the day to go asking around for a raise or some health coverage üòÇüòÇ

Work shenanigans aside, life definitely took its toll right at closing -- today we got 100% confirmation of a store regular that bought in bulk that died of coronavirus, and though my personal history with the man that passed didn't start out on the right foot, we eventually found new footing and he was always a pleasure to work with. Very courteous, and very hands-on while he helped his wife load their purchases onto their cart and into their car. I didn't catch his name, and there will undoubtedly be more regulars that eventually don't make it, it's a statistical given. But damn it stings.

RIP

blogContentHtml.title: REEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE
blogContentHtml.content:
I was so distracted by yesterday's shenanigans that I completely forgot to mention one of the most incredible things I've witnessed while working at this job: Militant Man being completely and utterly still for at least a minute or two. Like, it's reassuring to see that even the big powerhouse of the store has those brief and rare moments where it's just us and the store present with a good ole

But enough about the past! Right off the bat, before anything had even happened and definitely before I had even clocked in, I came across this beauty

Bu5ConaBaia BUSConoBia

And with a phone number, written on the sign that hangs off the office counter that tells people to practice social distancing. What's that beauty say? It says "Looking for girlfriend", but spelled "LOKINGPHORGRILFRED"

Some dude out there felt lonely and horny and said to himself "Tinder? WhatsApp? Facebook? Nah fam" and just put himself out there, shit handwriting and spelling and all on a piece of paper and let Jesus take the wheel. This man, whoever he is, singlehandedly invalidated anyone's doubts about asking that special someone out on a date, so biiiig props to the ballsy move. Hopefully he finds someone that knows how to read ‚à†(`-` )

So it turns out that people are still interested in purchasing the GIANT packs of toilet paper from when there was a toilet paper shortage from the initial coronavirus scare because some man walked in with his kid exclusively to buy one. Ngl, that thing brought back some nasty flashbacks to days on end where we had to argue with people to not be greedy assholes and buy all the toilet paper they could just because there was a shortage, and that was pretty evident in the way that Militant Man hesitated for a second to go figure out how much that thing costs. In the end, he bought it for $43 plus tax, but damn this man really just went through a year's worth in 4 months, so either he's got a big ass family, or ya know‚Ä¶ But that's none of my business lmaoo

Militant Man didn't earn his nickname from me out of nothingness. He's stern, direct, and will constantly give you tasks to execute. Idling is a no-go for him (hence why it's so rare to ever see him pause like I witnessed and why I mentioned it in a blog post), and in the approximately 20 years that I know he's been working at this store, he has mastered the art of interacting with the people of Latino background, from the most urban setting to the ranchiest of the ranch people whose Spanish I can't even understand as a native speaker. And yet, even the Militant Man himself has his cryptonite customer, and it's an older Karen that from now on will be known as Crypto Knight.

She's got it all baby. The short hair, the age, the stubby, tubby body, the nails, the jewelry, and the God awful piercing voice that reaches into the carcass of your once youthful and hopeful soul and eviscerates the little life left. From the moment she walked into the store, Militant Man hurried off to me and told me, straight up (not verbatim, but very heavily implied)

Careful with this woman man she's the f*cking crazy police.

Oh god.

Well, I've got my ways of dealing with these Karens, and thankfully it helps that I look like an older teenager when I'm clean shaven so they tend to cut me some slack for trying to hold the price and mask rules firmly in place. Sometimes they'll even laugh at the dumb shit I say on the fly to try and keep things going smoothly and get 'em outta here before I want to yank my hair out and quit for the day, but this Karen wasn't having any of that. Thankfully, she ignored my existence and spoke only to Militant Man directly, and when he wasn't around, she went and hunted his ass down, and made it clear as daylight that she wanted her TACO MEAT PASSED TWICE UNDER THE GRINDER.

God bless America, and the meat department people and Militant Man for handling this beast, because even after Militant Man continually told Crypto Knight that the meat was passed twice under the meat grinder, she got annoyed at the time delay and started getting loud and rowdy. At one point, Militant Man had enough and just started telling her the meat had been PASSED TWICE. IT'S PASSED TWICE HERE WE GO LOOK PASSED TWICE. She got fed up and started physically slapping Militant Man and chasing him around the register. Hoooly shit wow. It had a playful touch to it, but with these Men, it's hard to tell when something is foul play and when something is dead serious anger. Thankfully, today it was play and Crypto Knight left and everything was well.

After she was gone, Militant Man just looked at me and said

I told you man, when that woman comes in here I need everything to be perfect because she's worse than the police.

DAMN KAREN YOU SCARY CUH.

blogContentHtml.title: I got sexually hair-assed today.
blogContentHtml.content:
This morning brought in the Princess Brothers to the store. They are a couple of grown ass men that have little-to-no respect for anyone working here, and have no problems saying gross, reprehensible things in a loud voice for everyone and their mom to hear. In the days when the mask order for businesses went into effect, one of the Princess Brothers loudly and angrily yelled at a coworker for reminding him to wear a mask that it's not that big of a deal if he doesn't wear one, and that if he covers his face with his shirt it's the same as wearing a mask made out of a shirt. But pretty boy over here didn't stop there -- he kept on ranting and ranting about how this mask business is bs, and after a couple of minutes decided to get his foul-mouthed Princes Bro and just left. Today though, the Princess Brothers ordered EGGS WITH WEED and then bought god knows what else and left without so much as saying hello. Good fkn riddance.

But the real shenanigan of the day came from some old man that apparently doesn't know what hair is. So this dude comes to my register to pay for tacos or whatever, and so far so good. I've personally never seen him before, or if I have, he's definitely not a regular since I don't recognize him. He starts handing me his taco slip and drinks, and then he says "Dang you have a lot of hair". I couldn't really hear him through the loud fan and the music, but more importantly, I didn't want to believe that a grown ass man made a comment about my body hair so I said "Huh?". And he repeated himself

You are one hairy boy

Lmfao 'scuse me‚Ä¶.. what the fuck?? I thought I had heard it all, or at least, I couldn't be surprised by the unexpected with these people, and yet today proved me otherwise. I thought that would be the end of it, so I just said "I guess, I mean I don't really pay attention to my body hair". And I checked him out and he left. I started laughing my ass off after that because never in a billion years did I expect for some total fuckin' grown ass stranger to comment on my body hair like he's never seen that sh*t before. I'm not even that hairy, it's just that I have long arm hair so whatever.

But this man wasn't done, noooooo sir. He apparently, in the time that I was completely distracted by his commentary, went back and ordered more food from the taqueria, and he came back to my register. He said, "It's me again. Here you go my hairy man". Ooooooo‚Ä¶. at that point, it wasn't cute or funny anymore, but I wasn't about to start some sh*t before the sun rose, so I just brushed it off and ignored him. AND THEN HE ASKED ME IF I HAVE CHEST HAIR TOO üòµüòÇüòÇüòÇ I lost a little bit of my composure, and I responded to him, verbatim, "Shit man. Yeah, I have chest hair. I ain't no spring chicken my guy; I've been done with puberty for at least a decade bro I'm 25", and I guess he wasn't expecting that kind of a response because he sort of just awkwardly laughed and didn't really say much after that. Damn that was a weird exchange of words.

Grape Man is out of jail! Or at least, he was back this morning to shop for some stuff after being MIA for 2 or 3 days. Nothing spectacular other than buying 4 and commenting on how one time he accidentally asked for a coworker to get him his precious goodies, but he didn't realize that they were off and only here for their check, so he felt bad for interrupting them while off the clock üò≠üò≠

And finally, on today's edition of stoopid. Some numnuck stole a Michelob Ultra from the store, and instead of throwing away the bottle in some garbage can to hide the evidence, they left the damn thing under the urinal in the men's restroom ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

Let us pray.

These people are bots, prove me wrong.

Amen.

blogContentHtml.title: Same-same, but different, but stilllll same.
blogContentHtml.content:
Skipped yesterday's entry since it would just be a blank post. Instead, I decided to sleep, so whatever üòó Instead let's talk about how both the white bread and the milk fridge doors broke today. That was fun to deal with this morning :)

The rest of the morning and part of the afternoon was basically the same of the last couple of days, but Diet Coke Lady is especially on the crazy side lately. It's like she started taking up actual crack or something because she doesn't even respond to basic questions like "Do you want your receipt?" or "Do you want a bag?". She just looks at you with her smeared lipstick face as she does what she gotta do.

So the government gave away new EBT cards to many families while covid is still rampant, and so many more people still walk into the store not knowing how to even start using the card, which I don't consider a problem since everyone has to start somewhere. This middle-aged couple walked in, and from the moment the were in the door to the moment they were checking out, they were asking employees around if their EBT card could pay for specific items. Annoying, but again, everyone starts somewhere. Everything was fine‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ until they actually came to my register to pay. I rang everything they had up, and gave them their grand total. Instead of taking their shiny new card out though, the man pulls out his phone and starts making a phone call.

"Shit, it's gonna be one of those transactions" was my first thought, since a lot of people wait until they are at the register to call whoever the actual owner of their card is for the PIN. But no, this time it was far worse. This mf was out here activating his freaking card when it was time to pay. The worst part is that it took me a couple of minutes to register what this man was doing because it's such a rookie error, you'd think they're little kids trying to figure out how to pay alone for the first time ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è It's almost as bad as that lady that often leaves her debit card at home, so she waits in the f*cking line while her hubby goes all the way home to get her card, like‚Ä¶. wtf is wrong with you.

*sigh*

On the plus side, I've been working on getting my store playlist accessible through this page sometime in the near future, so that's in the works behind the scenes.

YEET.

blogContentHtml.title: Am dumb, ‚úì; am hard worker, also ‚úì
blogContentHtml.content:
I was supposed to be off, but I clocked in and worked almost 2 hours okay whatever. I'm poor, so fight me for my bills; I'll happily surrender.

The real deal comes thanks to QtSteel, so shoutouts for the good stuff. So apparently this old dude showed up out of nowhere like all old men tend to do, and had the munchies on the third-trimester order. No problem, the store specializes in meeting all of your crunchy, salty, sweet, sour, dry, moist, gummy, fuzzy, alcoholic cravings for all hours of the day. This man's particular munchies -- hot sauce and chips. In a classic twist of events, right before the transaction was about to go down and everybody would move on with their life, the man dropped his bottle of Valentina hot sauce and stank up the place in a way that only that hot sauce knows how to do. F*ck, at least it cleans up okay with some deodorizer and a broom after a few hours, so no biggie. But in the commotion of everything going on and the lack of caring for whatever the man was doing, his transaction eventually ended and it was time to move on to the next task at hand.

A mere five minutes tops after dingus man left, he came back and declared that he apparently "wasn't given his chips and avocado" even though QtSteel was almost certain that he took everything he had brought to the register to get charged. The story would have ended there and dingus man would have probably been given another set of his declared missing items‚Ä¶ if he had brought his receipt. It's a common sense thing to have when declaring these kinds of issues literally at any store anywhere in the Texas borders, and yet, dingus man was still surprised that he was asked to bring proof of purchase ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è I've seen kindergarteners understand basic stuff like this way faster than fully grown adults, I swear. His scandalous behavior got so annoying and insistent that Boss Man eventually got involved only to be told the same exact thing -- that he needs his receipt.

I can't remember how QtSteel told me this story ends, but the net effect of it all is that, as per usual, one ends up losing brain cells thinking about how bad people get over petty issues.

God, I love retail so much I want to do this on my off days too üôèüôè Amen.

blogContentHtml.title: Pease practice social distance
blogContentHtml.content:
Slow day today. Found a typo in the "professionally made" signs that ask for cooperation from the public for covid management. Packed some stuff n' called it a day.

No crazy folk this morning, thank God.

blogContentHtml.title: CaN i HaVe A dOlLaR O_o
blogContentHtml.content:
It's the end of the month, and bills and rent and all that other bullsh*t life expenses are at their peak once more. Who knows if any of those expenses apply to Diet Coke Lady, but her moves today definitely strike high on the desperation scale. She was on the prowl for more free goodies, and her strategy today was to come right around the time the morning cashiers were ending their shift and afternoon cashiers are starting. But now, unlike before, she's walking into the store knowing full well she has no money, and then bothers people right as she is "paying" to score some extra mercy/pressure points and have someone bail her out. On the one hand, feelsbadman, but on the other, this is so f*cking annoying to deal with I might just tell her to stop bothering people at least while they're in line.

THAT FACE WHEN YOU'RE SO KEEN ON GETTING FREE SHIT YOU KNOW WHEN THE CASHIERS CHANGE SHIFT TO TRY AND GET DOUBLE FREE GOODIES

But enough about this crazy woman. The real fun shenanigan of the day was brought to you in part by myself, Josad Major, and a King-class customer. Normally, every Sunday involves me taking orders and gathering items into carts to get them charged and then either delivering them myself or someone else delivering them via the store van. This King-class customer mixed up the usual order today and wanted a "box of aluminum". That could mean anything from one tube of rolled up aluminum (which comes in a gazillion varieties), to sheets of aluminum (which also come in different sizes). I ended up having to call them and ask to clarify what they meant, and it turns out that they wanted the aluminum sheets for tacos. No worries, ezpz lemon squeezy. I gathered their loot, put a single box of aluminum foil sheets for tacos, Boss Man charged it all up, and it was sent to their location.

The real problem surfaced a couple of hours later when Boss Man sent Josad Major to their location to exchange money; usually these King-class customers ask for little bills to give change for large bills, but I guess that Boss Man forgot to send it with the major order. Well, it turns out that some crazy bitch at this taqueria went full ham on Josad Major's ass because even though he was sent exclusively for exchanging the money, the lady in charge was not going to give him anything until she got her aluminum üòÇüòÇüòÇ Josad Major literally didn't know what the actual f was going on and why he was fighting this woman for what should have been a straightforward exchange, so he ended up calling Boss Man and talking to her on the phone because apparently it was turning into a giant shitshow LMAOO Poor Josad Major.

In the end, Boss Man ended up apologizing and sending them their aluminum and whatnot, and he ended up blaming me for the whole ordeal. I didn't think much of it, since it's whatever and crazy bitches be crazy, but after Boss Man hung up the phone with the lady he started laughing his ass off and calling that woman crazy and how she was dumb because even after calling her to verify the order she still couldn't get it right.

Fucking A üòÇ

I DON'T CARE ABOUT THE WEATHER, WHAT'S REALLY IMPORTANT IS THE MAJOR FALLOUT FROM WHEN TRUMP IS REMOVED FROM OFFICE. IF YOU DON'T ALREADY HAVE 2 WEEKS WORTH OF FOOD, YOU SHOULD STOCK UP. YOU SHOULD ALSO BUY AMMUNITION FOR YOUR SHOTGUN IF YOU HAVE ANY

blogContentHtml.title: Warning: People are stupid and shouldn't be allowed to procreate without a license.
blogContentHtml.content:
For the next story to make sense, first we have to get the obvious out of the way. Coronavirus is no joke, and it's not going away because people get tired of dealing with it. Even though at the time of this writing information on the virus is relatively new (less than a year vs decades for other, well-known pathogens/viruses), it's been confirmed by studies around the world by scientists working around the clock that this thing is especially dangerous to those with compromised immune systems, children, and the elderly. At this point in time it should come of no surprise that the general consensus by health authorities is that one should continue to avoid exposure as much as possible until a vaccine or heard immunity is reached -- this means not now, but maybe in a year or potentially even longer.

Like I mentioned in another earlier post, the county judge ordered that face masks must be worn in locations where social distancing is not physically possible. This 100% means that our location is not exempted, and so it's our duty to do our part and enforce mask usage from the general population that walks in. I've had to deal with apathy by part of some coworkers and even the freaking Men, and so it's a two-front battle that needs to be won. Thankfully, today there were much fewer people walking into the store without a face mask, and those that did were very compliant with obtaining or buying one to shop.

But this one woman really went full stupid today. Thankfully, she didn't get physically or verbally abusive; that would probably get the cops called on her. She was wearing a mask, so no one really paid any attention to her on her way in, but close behind her walked in a child without a face mask. I never noticed the kid since he's short and my view was blocked, but a few minutes later I saw Female Me walking behind her talking about masks and the like, and their body language wasn't positive so I decided to go check what was going on, and I almost immediately wished I didn't see anything.

This masked adult woman was arguing with Female Me over why her child doesn't need to be wearing a mask. He HaS aStHmA aNd ThE rUlEs SaY tHaT oNlY cHiLdReN oVeR 10 aRe ReQuIrEd tO wEaR a MaSk ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüòêüî´ This woman brought her CHILD with ASTHMA to a grocery store, aka a mathematically proven breeding ground for any pathogen (and God knows what other inappropriate places this poor kid has been taken to prior to this rule being in effect). Setting aside the extra vulnerability of this child, I've heard stories from nurses that work in hospitals that coronavirus does way worse things inside of a child's body than in an adult's, and with cases surging in Texas as people realize that reopening too soon was definitely a bad idea, it's only a matter of time before the virus reaches critical mass and everyone knows someone, or themselves becomes, infected. I'm sure that this ranks for some sort of abuse by ignorance in some law somewhere, right alongside child obesity, but that's a whole other can of worms not eligible for discussion here.

But covid shenanigans aside for a second -- I have finally found the Goddess among men. She is the Chosen One, the one who knows how to pass EBT manually where even Militant Man had no power. Female Me surprised me with this beautiful token today, and finally all of the rumors from customers claiming to have recently have their transactions work by hand suddenly don't sound like hogwash to get me to do their bidding lmao. The secret sauce -- just use a month that's not the current one in the future that's also not December of the current year. That is all it takes apparently, I witnessed it work myself ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüòÇ

blogContentHtml.title: Day 362 down, 3 more to go.
blogContentHtml.content:
Funny how just six months ago feels like it was years ago. The amount of major world events that came in and impacted our daily lives far faaaar exceeds that which has been seen in this country for at least a couple of generations. Stranger still, to me, is to think that I've spent even more time than that, basically a year of my life, working at this store. Ignoring the national/world events currently taking place, I never imagined all of the people, the customers, the coworkers, the interactions, the prices, and on and on and on that I would grow to love and hate in such a short (albeit eternally feeling) period of time. I've worked with people that I didn't even know were employed there until an embarrasing amount of time had gone by. I've worked with people that I got to just barely know before they moved on with their life. I've worked with people that left and came back, and left again because why not. I've spent well over 100 hours outside of work just to finding and assembling a good playlist that doesn't sound repetitive for me and those that have to be there with me the entire time. I've dedicated hundreds more hours to creating tools to assist the higher ups and myself with the price fluctuations of the markets whose whims we must obey.

And that's just me, because it's whose story I know. I just want to throw in a big thank you to my coworkers that have had the unfortune of working with me and for laughing at the meanie clients with me, for helping ourselves cool off after a big fuckup or two, and for just making a fantastic team whose coordination together pulls through at the end of the day despite the obstacles or Man in the way (no offence to the Men, but sometimes it's the Men that make work unnecessarily stressful and they know it so shhh). To my coworkers that no longer work here, we miss you fam; hope you're doing well and are moving up and up to greater, greener pastures.

Maybe not everyone stumbling across this is in a very thankful mood, and that's perfectly valid too. Life is hard, work is hard, and it ain't easy being stuck in what seems to be an endless void of fill in your crux here. Just remember the phrase:

This too shall pass.

And look forward to the next day; the next step; the next opening. The sun rises every day, and we keep moving forward.

So yea, work was slow today, wbu?

blogContentHtml.title: Masks are required bY oRdEr Of ThE cOuNtY jUdGe again lmao
blogContentHtml.content:
So the order to enforce mask usage by the county judge went into effect starting this morning at 12am, which means that any business that gets caught with people not wearing a mask inside will face a $1000 fine. Boss Man is scared to lose 60¬¢ on a single item, so it only makes sense that the potential to lose $1000 will certainly get those money gears running in him.

This new law signed into effect meant that my shift today was 30% about cashiering, and 60% about hearding the crowds of people walking in to get them to wear their masks, and my god was it tiresome. Like, it's not the worst thing in the world, especially since most people comply and reasonably try to wear their masks, but that tiny fraction of people that offer resistance really makes me question if my sh*tshow today was even worth the trouble. All it takes is one good period of me being away from the store and suddenly all of the work I put in to changing the status quo fades into nothingness. I'm hoping my coworkers will be able to keep up that energy I put in, but if not, I don't see myself going back into 150% mode to get things back to day one. I had to have a lot of awkward interactions with friendly non-compliant customers today üòñ

Classic Grape Man saw me enforcing the mask rule, and with his mastery of law and divinity informed me that the workaround to the mask requirement is by holding a drink in your hand because "it's perfectly legal to not wear a mask while drinking or eating" lol At least he was covering his face like a champ, so props to him for following the new old rules.

blogContentHtml.title: Sunday Sh*tshow with Boss Man and Friends
blogContentHtml.content:
Everything was indeed not fine, and everything that could go wrong with the meat department did: worker shortages, hospitalizations from big cuts, supply mismanagement, order loss, you name it. Normally it really isn't front end people's jobs to worry about shenanigans in the back, but the void left by the dude that cut himself meant that I got (pro? de?)moted to delivery boy for the store's King-class customers. So today my day got split into delivery, loadout, cashiering, packaging, maintenance, and modeling (because apparently according to multiple elderly women I'm a papacito üòö).

So besides doing real work today other than typing numbers into a keyboard and the meat department on the brink of collapse today (I logged 8 miles today lmao), nothing much else noteworthy happened. Eevee's gone, so I got assigned the morning shift for all week starting tomorrow for 5:30am, so at least I won't have to deal with the god awful pm-to-am work days for this week.

‚úå

Other than me showboating my skills at a ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ job, I didn't really have much time nor leftover attention to get good content for the blog today (I didn't even have time to get a quick snack or something before leaving lol).
